alert.note: Alert for Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 14 at 3:29PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern St. Tammany Parish, western Harrison, Hancock and southeastern Pearl River Counties through 415 PM CST... At 328 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mcneil to near Slidell. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Picayune, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Diamondhead, Pearl River, Saucier, Kiln, Pearlington, Mcneil, Shoreline Park and Stennis Space Center. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 259 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 26. Interstate 12 between mile markers 82 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany
